item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Score, 3rd Test, Day 4: Jasprit Bumrah, Akash Deep's Fightback Ends Australia's Follow-On Plan At Stumps - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia, 3rd Test, Day 4 Highlights

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: NDTV Sports

The fourth day of the ongoing third Test between India and Australia showcased a remarkable performance by Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep, allowing India to avoid following on. At stumps, India scored 252/9, trailing by 193 runs.

  • India managed to avoid follow-on thanks to Bumrah and Deep's resilience.
  • KL Rahul scored 84 runs, while Ravindra Jadeja contributed 77 runs.
  • Pat Cummins took four wickets for Australia, with Mitchell Starc claiming three.
“AND THEY HAVE DONE IT!!!!! India have finally avoided the follow-on.”

The gripping contest on Day 4 ended with India poised to fight back further in the ongoing Test series, with their lower order showing impressive fight.

item.title: Magnesium Benefits: Why do we need more magnesium during winter? - The Times of India
item.description:
Why Increased Magnesium Intake is Essential During Winter

Publication Date: Date Not Specified | Source: Source Not Specified

As winter arrives, our bodies face new challenges. The days grow shorter, temperatures drop, and our routines shift, impacting our health. Magnesium plays a crucial role in helping navigate the colder months.

  • Magnesium regulates mood and helps combat Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD).
  • It aids in handling stress by regulating the HPA axis and enhancing GABA's relaxing effects.
  • Magnesium supports immune function, helping to fend off winter illnesses.
  • It is critical for heart health and blood circulation during cold weather.
  • Magnesium improves sleep quality, countering disruptions from reduced daylight.
“Ensuring sufficient magnesium intake can help stabilize your mood and improve overall mental well-being during the darker months.”

Incorporating magnesium-rich foods or supplements during winter can support both physical and mental health.

item.title: Hazlewood likely to miss rest of India series with calf strain - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Josh Hazlewood Likely to Miss Remainder of India Series Due to Calf Strain

Publication Date: December 2023

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Josh Hazlewood is expected to miss the rest of the Test series against India after suffering a calf strain during warm-ups in Brisbane. Scott Boland is likely to replace him for the upcoming Boxing Day Test.

  • Hazlewood experienced difficulties and had to leave the field after bowling one over.
  • Cricket Australia confirmed he sustained a right-sided calf strain.
  • Brendan Doggett and Sean Abbott are potential replacements for Hazlewood.
  • The Australian team is facing challenges due to rain delays and now has to rely on a limited bowling lineup.
  • Hazlewood had previously returned to the team after another injury and has missed significant play in recent seasons.
"It's not necessarily your typical side strain... It's caused me a lot of trouble over the last few years." - Josh Hazlewood

This injury raises concerns about Hazlewood's future in the series and his ongoing battle with injuries, impacting the Australian cricket team's dynamics.

item.title: Day after Palestine bag, Priyanka Gandhi carries tote with ‘Bangladesh’ message to Parliament - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Day after Palestine bag, Priyanka Gandhi carries tote with ‘Bangladesh’ message to Parliament

Date: December 16, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Priyanka Gandhi has drawn attention once again by carrying a tote bag with messages highlighting the atrocities faced by minorities in Bangladesh, just a day after her earlier appearance with a bag supporting Palestine.

  • Priyanka and other Opposition MPs protested in Parliament with tote bags and placards advocating for minority rights in Bangladesh.
  • The attention on Priyanka Gandhi's Palestine bag raised discussions about the Indian government's stance on Bangladesh's minority issues.
  • She criticized the BJP for focusing on her choice of bag rather than addressing the pressing issues of minority rights.
  • Opposition members have been using symbolic gestures to draw attention to various political issues during the current Winter Session of Parliament.
Priyanka Gandhi stated, "The atrocities happening in Bangladesh, against minorities and Hindus...something should be done regarding this. Talks should be held with Bangladesh govt regarding this...and they should not say such useless things".

This latest appearance by Priyanka Gandhi reinforces the ongoing political discourse around minority rights in Bangladesh and the strategic use of symbolism in political protests.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Score, 3rd Test, Day 4: Follow-On Threat Looms On India As Rain Forces Early Tea - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 3rd Test, Day 4: Dramatic End Awaits as India Struggles to Avoid Follow-On

Date: December 17, 2024
Source: NDTV Sports

India faces a dramatic situation with nine of its players down, as they aim to avoid a follow-on against Australia in the ongoing third Test. Onlookers are on edge as Pat Cummins has taken multiple wickets, while the weather poses challenges with a forecast of rain.

  • Pat Cummins has taken his fourth wicket, dismissing Ravindra Jadeja for 77.
  • Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep are currently unbeaten as India struggles at 213/9.
  • A 90% chance of rain is predicted for the next two days of play in Brisbane.
  • The Australian bowlers are focused on wrapping up India's innings quickly.
“Nine-down India are on the verge of follow-on.”

The match continues with high tension as each run becomes critical for India's survival in the match.

item.title: Mrunal Thakur replaces Shruti Haasan in Adivi Sesh’s Dacoit - 123telugu
item.description:
Mrunal Thakur replaces Shruti Haasan in Adivi Sesh’s Dacoit

Published on Dec 17, 2024 by 123telugu

The Telugu film Dacoit sees Mrunal Thakur stepping into the lead role, previously held by Shruti Haasan. Directed by Shaniel Deo, this film unfolds as a gripping love story intertwined with daring robberies.

  • Adivi Sesh celebrates his birthday while gearing up for the film's release.
  • Touched by intense emotions, the film's promotional posters highlight a troubled relationship.
  • The storyline features former lovers forced into a series of robberies that change their lives.
  • Produced by Supriya Yarlagadda, the film is shot in both Hindi and Telugu.
  • Current filming locations include Hyderabad and planned shoots in Maharashtra.
This ambitious project is aimed at captivating audiences with its thrilling narrative and character dynamics.

Overall, Dacoit promises to be an exciting addition to Mrunal Thakur's and Adivi Sesh's film journeys, highlighting the complexities of love and crime.

item.title: ‘India was just an ally’: Bangladesh politicians upset over PM Modi's Vijay Diwas post - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bangladesh Politicians Criticize Modi's Vijay Diwas Post for Ignoring Bangladesh

Date: December 17, 2024, Source: HT News

Bangladeshi politicians expressed their discontent over Prime Minister Modi's social media post regarding Vijay Diwas, where he failed to mention Bangladesh's significant role in the 1971 liberation war.

  • PM Modi commemorated Indian soldiers’ victory over Pakistan on December 16, 1971.
  • Critics from Bangladesh highlighted the exclusion of their country in the context of the war's significance for their independence.
  • Increased tensions exist between India and Bangladesh over treatment of the Hindu minority in Bangladesh.
  • Bangladesh's ex-prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been mentioned in relation to ongoing political instability in Bangladesh.
Asif Nazrul (law adviser to Muhammad Yunus): “I strongly protest. December 16, 1971, was the day of Bangladesh's victory. India was an ally in this victory, nothing more.”
“I strongly condemn and protest against Narendra Modi's misleading statement on 16th December, Bangladesh's Victory Day.” - Ishraque Hossain (Bangladesh Nationalist Party)

The reactions from Bangladeshi politicians signal potential strains in the diplomatic relationship between the two nations, emphasizing the importance of recognizing Bangladesh's history and sovereignty.

item.title: India sets up the first diabetes biobank in Chennai. Here's why this is significant - Firstpost
item.description:
India sets up the first diabetes biobank in Chennai. Here's why this is significant

Date & Source: Publication Date: [Not Specified], Source: Firstpost

The diabetes biobank, a collaboration between the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and the Madras Diabetes Research Foundation (MDRF), promises to boost scientific research and treatment for diabetes. Image for Representation. Pixabay

Introduction: India has established the country’s first-ever diabetes biobank in Chennai, aiming to enhance scientific research and treatment for diabetes.

  1. The biobank is a collaboration between the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and the Madras Diabetes Research Foundation (MDRF).
  2. It houses an extensive collection of blood samples from various types of diabetes, including Type 1, Type 2, and gestational diabetes.
  3. The biobank will facilitate advanced research on the causes of diabetes and related disorders.
  4. It could help in the identification of novel biomarkers for early diagnosis and the development of personalized treatment strategies.
  5. The biobank will support longitudinal studies to track diabetes progression and complications.
  6. Blood samples come from two major ICMR-funded studies: The ICMR-INDIAB and the Registry of People with Diabetes in India at a Young Age at Onset.
“This diabetes biobank could help in the identification of novel biomarkers for early diagnosis and the development of personalized treatment strategies,” an article in the Indian Journal of Medical Research stated.

Conclusion: The establishment of India's first diabetes biobank is a significant step towards improving diabetes research and treatment, potentially benefiting millions affected by the disease.

item.title: Russia Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov Killed In Moscow Bomb Blast: Report - Times Now
item.description:
Russia Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov Killed In Moscow Bomb Blast: Report

Date: Unspecified
Source: Russia Today

Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov, head of the Radiation, Chemical and Biological Defense Troops of the Russian Armed Forces, died in an explosion in Moscow on Monday. Another individual was also killed in the blast, which occurred outside an apartment in Ryazansky Prospekt.

  • The incident was reported by an unidentified law enforcement source to Russia Today.
  • The Russian investigative committee confirmed Kirillov's death and has opened a criminal case.
  • Kirillov was recently charged by Ukrainian prosecutors for alleged use of banned chemical weapons in Ukraine.
  • The UK government had previously sanctioned Kirillov for the deployment of chemical weapons in Ukraine.
  • Reports allege that Russian forces have used toxic substances and chemical grenades against Ukrainian positions.
“Kirillov has also been a significant mouthpiece for Kremlin disinformation, spreading lies to mask Russia’s shameful and dangerous behaviour.” - UK government press release

This incident raises significant concerns regarding the ongoing conflict in Ukraine and the use of chemical weapons on the battlefield.

item.title: Pushpa 2 Box Office Collections: Allu Arjun film has a superb 2nd Monday, remains on track to beat Baahubali 2 - PINKVILLA
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Collections: Allu Arjun film has a superb 2nd Monday, remains on track to beat Baahubali 2

Published on Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Pinkvilla

The second week for Pushpa 2 is projected to earn close to Rs. 300 crore, with a total exceeding Rs. 1100 crore by the end of the week.

  • Pushpa 2 grossed over Rs. 30 crore on its second Monday.
  • The film dropped just 28% from its second Friday.
  • The twelve-day total gross at the Indian box office now stands at approximately Rs. 1040 crore.
  • The Hindi version collected a superb Rs. 22 crore approx, nearly approaching Baahubali 2.
  • The film is expected to cross Rs. 700 crore nett in Hindi.
The second week is projected to earn close to Rs. 300 crore, with a total exceeding Rs. 1100 crore by the end of the week.

With strong holds in North India and the Telugu states, Pushpa 2 is expected to continue its impressive run at the box office.

item.title: 5 mesmerising star formation images captured by NASA James Webb Space Telescope - HT Tech
item.description:
5 Mesmerising Star Formation Images Captured by NASA James Webb Space Telescope

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: HT TECH

This article presents five stunning images of star formation, beautifully captured by the NASA James Webb Space Telescope, shedding light on the fascinating processes involved in star formation.

  • Star formation can occur through various means such as the collision of different molecular clouds and galaxies.
  • It takes between 10,000 to 100,000 years for a star to reach its fully formed shape.
  • The Hubble and Webb telescopes have unveiled mesmerizing images showcasing young star clusters and star formation regions.
  • Notable regions explored include NGC 602 and NGC 604, which are hotbeds of stellar activity.
  • The Rho Ophiuchi cloud complex is highlighted as the closest star-forming region to Earth.
“These images demonstrate the ongoing processes of star formation and the beauty of the universe.”

This collection of images reminds us of the vastness and complexity of our universe and the exciting discoveries facilitated by advanced space telescopes.

item.title: iPhone 15 256GB variant gets huge price drop, check cheapest deal here - India TV News
item.description:
iPhone 15 256GB variant gets huge price drop, check cheapest deal here

Publication Date: December 14, 2024 | Source: India TV News

The price of the iPhone 15 has seen another significant reduction, making it more accessible on popular e-commerce sites. A price cut of Rs 10,000 was implemented following the launch of the iPhone 16, especially on the 256GB variant.

Key Points:

  • 256GB variant available on Flipkart for Rs 70,999, with a potential final price of Rs 69,999 after discounts.
  • Amazon lists the 256GB variant at Rs 75,900, with potential final price of Rs 71,900 after discounts.
  • The iPhone 15 features a 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR display and A16 Bionic chipset.
  • Also includes a dual-camera setup with a 48MP main camera.
“BSNL aims to reach a total of 100,000 4G sites by mid-2025 and is preparing for the launch of its 5G services.”

This new price drop of the iPhone 15, particularly for the 256GB variant, presents an exciting opportunity for consumers looking to upgrade their devices.

item.title: Apple working on a new iPad-like foldable device: Report - The Hindu
item.description:
Apple Working on a New Foldable iPad-Like Device Set for 2028 Release

Published on: December 17, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Apple is reportedly set to release a large foldable iPad-like device by 2028. Leaked information suggests the device could serve dual functions as either a Mac or an iPad.

  • The foldable device is expected to be 18.8 inches with an almost invisible crease.
  • Rumors of this product have been circulating, with various reports suggesting Apple aims to enter the foldable market.
  • Apple also plans to release OLED MacBook Pros in 2026 and an updated MacBook Air in 2027.
  • A foldable iPhone is also in development but is not expected to be released before 2026.
“Apple hasn't confirmed these reports yet.”

In conclusion, Apple’s advance into foldable technology with a potential release of a large foldable iPad device highlights its innovative trajectory in the tech space.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session Day 18 LIVE Updates: Simultaneous elections Bill likely to be introduced in Lok Sabha; Rajya Sabha resumes Constitution Debate - The Hindu
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session Day 18 LIVE Updates: Division of votes in LS after Oppn. seeks withdrawal of ONOE bill; Constitution debate continues in RS

Date & Source: December 17, 2024 - The Hindu

The Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha are in session for the 18th day of the winter session while discussions on key bills, including the One Nation One Election (ONOE) bill, are ongoing.

  • The Constitution Amendment bill for simultaneous elections was introduced and a division of votes occurred, where 269 members supported it and 198 opposed it.
  • Opposition leaders demanded the withdrawal of the ONOE bill citing concerns over its impact on the Constitution.
  • Prominent statements were made regarding the necessity of federalism and checks on centralized power.
  • Various party leaders indicated their stance on issues including agricultural support and unemployment rates, emphasizing the diverse opinions in the House.
“The ONOE bill is an affront to the constitutionally established structure of our democracy.” - Supriya Sule, NCP

The ongoing debates reflect a complex interplay of political dynamics as various interests are represented in the session.

Source: Times of India

The anticipated sequel 'Pushpa: The Rule' has broken records since its theatrical release, and fans are eager for its OTT debut.

  • 'Pushpa 2' will stream on Netflix.
  • The streaming rights were acquired for Rs 275 crore.
  • Expected OTT release around February 2025, 6-8 weeks after theatrical release.
  • Available in multiple languages: Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam, Kannada, and Hindi.
“Director Sukumar’s brilliance shines through in Pushpa 2: The Rule. He masterfully balances a mass entertainer with a film rich in social commentary.” - ETimes

The movie's successful theatrical run has set high expectations for its upcoming OTT release.
